ygData.subject: RE: [rest-discuss] Static or Dynamic URI's
ygData.msgSnippet: REST doesn t care about how we send the data right? so we can send the data(KEY) by URI or as request parameters. Thanks bud ...

REST doesn't care about how we send the data right? so
we can send the data(KEY) by URI or as request
parameters.

Thanks
bud
--- Josh Knowles <josh.knowles@...>
wrote:
> Adding the key to the url is the preferred way to do
> it.  Then you
> reference all get/delete/post/put 's directly to
> that url.
>  
> Josh
> 
> 	-----Original Message-----
> 	From: bud [mailto:buddy1908@...] 
> 	Sent: Tuesday, January 14, 2003 11:39 AM
> 	To: rest-discuss@yahoogroups.com
> 	Subject: [rest-discuss] Static or Dynamic URI's
> 	
> 	
> 	
> 	Hi,
> 	
> 	  Should the URI be static or can it be Dynamic
> too. 
> 	For example if I want to get a object from the
> 	database, if I know the key of the object then can
> I
> 	send the key of the object in the URI instead of
> 	sending in the message.
> 	
> 	like 
> 	http://server:port/addressbook/SSN
> 	
> 	
> 	Thanks
> 	bud
